data.text:
@UKCovid19Stats NEW: for the first time in the pandemic, a Covid infection now carries less mortality risk than a flu infection in England, the result of widespread immunity and the emergence of a less virulent variant in Omicron.

Our story: https://t.co/Br6OXHI0We https://t.co/zTz2zpmnk3

@JimFellows1 @Paul__Terry @skepticalzebra @UKCovid19Stats @kallmemeg More generally though (beyond the current spike), I’d say the advice is to either stop paying attention to covid stats or get used to the fact that there will be peaks and troughs in cases. 

It’s simply part of the world we live in now and shouldn’t be alarming/surprising.
@Docdover @JackHodgson7 @RamousKodes @UKCovid19Stats How do you know they’d still be alive?

@JackHodgson7 @RamousKodes @UKCovid19Stats Oh dear Jack, 2yrs on &you still dont get it. If someone with leukaemia catches covid and dies then both covid and leukaemia go on the death certificate. If that same person hadn’t caught covid they would still be alive. Try and learn the basics of medicine before tweeting again
@RamousKodes @JackHodgson7 @UKCovid19Stats Look at the ICU numbers. Still dropping
@blue_scouse @UKCovid19Stats Only if your a bed wetter !!
@UKCovid19Stats Nothing to see here.  Living with Johnson that's all.
